question: Baker made 43 cakes and 114 pastries. If he sold 154 pastries and 78 cakes. How many more pastries than cakes did baker sell?
response:
The baker made 43 cakes and 114 pastries, so he had a total of 43 + 114 = 157 pastries and cakes.
He sold 154 pastries and 78 cakes, so he sold a total of 154 + 78 = 232 pastries and cakes.
The difference between the total he made and the total he sold is 157 - 232 = -75.
The baker sold 78 cakes, so he sold 78 - 75 = 3 more cakes than he made.
The baker sold 154 pastries, so he sold 154 - 114 = 40 more pastries than he made.
The baker sold 40 more pastries than cakes.
The answer is 40.
